text: hashtag security
hey <@U02618EV1> here's our standup status -
as i'm sure you've seen on the email threads the security scans are being kicked off this morning
we just got off a call with jason who is running them, and has said they will take 2 hours
so we're going to stand by until the scans are run and we see what comes back from them around noon
if there are issues we'll need to resolve them and let him know, so scans can be rerun to verify, for approval to move to production
i will let you know if we can results back that need your help
Great. Thanks letting me know. I’ll be on stand-by here.
so it looks like line 13 if for the WP login page
<@U02E3CRMA> 13 may just be about preventing the form from autocompleting
Maybe using something like <https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/Security/Securing_your_site/Turning_off_form_autocompletion> may fix it

attachments.title: How to Turn Off Form Autocompletion
attachments.text: This article explains how a website can disable autocomplete for form fields.
attachments.fallback: Mozilla Developer Network: How to Turn Off Form Autocompletion

text: I think there’s two things - disabling the “remember me” button, and disabling auto-complete
I’ll edit the login php now to fix both...
Problem is, this is WP core stuff. So we either make a quick change now but it will be gone on the next WP update or we complete recreate the login page with custom code to include those changes.
I’m trying to log into dev.fathom but it doesn’t look like I can access it from home.
i think we make the quick change and mention that it may be overridden with a new WP update
we don't have time or resources to rebuild the wordpress login page
That sound great
fixed the XML-RPC issues, and fixed the autofill by installing a plugin that globally disables as well as removing the “Remember me” button from the login screen
Wow. That was smart.
ok guys, plan is to keep an eye on email, and when we get the results back from the remaining scans let's take a look and see what we need to resolve tomorrow.
i'd love to meet you both (<@U02618EV1> and <@U02E3CRMA>) in our war room tomorrow morning so we can divide and conquer
